title: Restaurants
name: Restaurants
description:
A Map by Indirectlylit

places to eat

properties.name: Alias
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 76 Clinton St, New York, NY

properties.name: Bogota
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 141 5th ave, brooklynbright, colorful atmosphere and very good food. usually good service but it\'s been bad also

properties.name: Catch de Fish
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 143 3rd aveAn new take on Thai food. They have a lot of seafood on the menu, and do a build-your-own entree thing where you specify a sauce and substance. hopefully it will stay BYOB. nice atmosphere

properties.name: Church Restaurant Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit  424 Church Ave, Brooklyn NYGreat breakfasts and lunches, very cheap. Try the chicken souvlaki, gyros, and greek omlettes. Be prepared for slow service, but the folks who run it are very nice.

properties.name: East Village Thai
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 32 E 7th StHole in the wall. Excellent food at reasonable prices, especially for lunch.

properties.name: Fez Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit    240 Prospect Park WestNice backyard garden for when it\'s nice out. Large portions, very tender meat. Others have given it mediocre reviews

properties.name: Itzocan Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit   438 E 9th StVery cozy (potentially cramped, but usually not too bad). Great food, though not a very large selection. Good sangria.

properties.name: Joya
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 215 Court St, Brooklyn, NYGood food, surprisingly cheap. Big place but very popular - be prepared to wait for a table. Loud, but comfortable.

properties.name: Lahore Deli
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 132 Crosby St, New York, NYDamn good Pakistani food for really really cheap. Try eating at the counter and enjoy drinking from the large cooler of ice water.

properties.name: Mo-Ra-Kote
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 35 Carmine Streetvery good thai in a small restaurant. They make it really spicy - sometimes the air in there stings your eyes a bit from frying peppers. But it\'s reasonably priced and even better, BYOB.

properties.name: Mura
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 369 5th Ave, BrooklynTried the grilled red snapper with spicy miso sauce - amazing.

properties.name: New/Nice Green Bo
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 66 bayard, new york, nyOne of the better chinatown chinese restaurants I\'ve tried.

properties.name: Nha Trang
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 87 Baxter St, New York, NYThere are plenty of Vietnamese restaurants on Baxter, but this one is the one I keep returning to. Everything is very fresh and the prices cannot be beat.

properties.name: Nyonya
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 194 Grand St, New York, NYWent with a large group of people and ordered a wide range of items. Almost everything was excellent.

properties.name: Pakistan Tea House
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 176 Church Street, 10013Great food at great prices.

properties.name: Summers
properties.description: Posted by Indirectlylit 49 Clinton St., New York 10002
